If the password or unique device id are lost, the device codes may be reset by SMS. New codes will be sent to the number:
Lock the device with the existing password. Use in case of lost device when password is still secure.
Retreive the current location of the device by GPS if possible, or through network tower coverage otherwise. SMS will report the Latitude, Longitude, Altitude, and Accuracy where available.

Present a new screen to the user asking user to Please Wait, with the body of the SMS message presented to the user as a dialog box. The user will not be able to readily exit this screen, so it may, for example, be used to communicate to the user while wiping data in the background.
Resets the device password to a default password of 0. Given that this will not conform to the device policy, the user will be requested to change the password on next unlock.
Performs a wipe of all Patient Data before conducting a full wipe of internal memory and factory reset. The device will reboot and guide user through the initial device setup instructions again.

Performs a wipe of all Patient data. This includes patient information from OpenMRS and all forms previously filled out on the device, but does not include SMS messages, notes, or calendar obligations that may still contain sensitive patient data.
Be default, all SMS codes sent to the device will repeat until they are complete. This message will cancel the current alarms.

Reset the administration code used for all SMS messages. This will be sent to the phone number registered on the device as the administrator. This phone number can be changed under Device Administration section.

Lock the device with a new secure password that conforms to the device policy. This password is randomly generated and saved by the device itself. The only method of resetting this password is to send another SMS requesting password be reset to a default of 0.
